speaker: Nora
text: Hey Marcus! You went to ReactConf last week, right? How was it?
ipa: heɪ ˈmɑrkəs | ju wɛnt tu riˈækt kɑnf læst wik | raɪt | haʊ wəz ɪt
stress: HEY MARCUS | YOU WENT TO REACTCONF LAST WEEK | RIGHT | HOW WAS IT
linking:
"went to" → /wɛnt tu/ (t links to t)
"how was it" → /haʊ wəz ɪt/ (w links to i)

speaker: Marcus
text: Oh, it was absolutely incredible. The talks were far more insightful than I expected.
ipa: oʊ | ɪt wəz ˌæbsəˈlutli ɪnˈkrɛdəbəl | ðə tɔks wɚ fɑr mɔr ɪnˈsaɪtfəl ðən aɪ ɪkˈspɛktɪd
stress: OH | IT WAS ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE | THE TALKS WERE FAR MORE INSIGHTFUL THAN I EXPECTED
linking:
"it was" → /ɪt wəz/ (t links to w)
"talks were" → /tɔks wɚ/ (s links to w)

speaker: Nora
text: That’s awesome. Was it more focused on performance or design patterns?
ipa: ðæts ˈɔsəm | wəz ɪt mɔr ˈfoʊkəst ɑn pɚˈfɔrməns ɔr dɪˈzaɪn ˈpætɚnz
stress: THAT’S AWESOME | WAS IT MORE FOCUSED ON PERFORMANCE OR DESIGN PATTERNS
linking:
"focused on" → /ˈfoʊkəst ɑn/ (t links to o)
"design patterns" → /dɪˈzaɪn ˈpætɚnz/ (n links to p)

speaker: Marcus
text: A bit of both. There was a session about micro frontends that was just as relevant for back-end folks too. They explained things really clearly.
ipa: ə bɪt əv boʊθ | ðɛr wəz ə ˈsɛʃən əˈbaʊt ˈmaɪkroʊ ˈfrʌntɛndz ðæt wəz dʒəst æz ˈrɛləvənt fɚ ˈbækˌɛnd foʊks tu | ðeɪ ɪkˈspleɪnd θɪŋz ˈrɪli ˈklɪrli
stress: A BIT OF BOTH | THERE WAS A SESSION ABOUT MICRO FRONTENDS THAT WAS JUST AS RELEVANT FOR BACK-END FOLKS TOO | THEY EXPLAINED THINGS REALLY CLEARLY
linking:
"bit of" → /bɪt əv/ (t links to o)
"just as" → /dʒəst æz/ (t links to a)

speaker: Nora
text: Sounds like it! I watched the recording of the animations talk, and the speaker was so engaging.
ipa: saʊndz laɪk ɪt | aɪ wɑʧt ðə rɪˈkɔrdɪŋ əv ði ˌænəˈmeɪʃənz tɔk | ənd ðə ˈspiːkɚ wəz soʊ ɪnˈɡeɪdʒɪŋ
stress: SOUNDS LIKE IT | I WATCHED THE RECORDING OF THE ANIMATIONS TALK | AND THE SPEAKER WAS SO ENGAGING
linking:
"watched the" → /wɑʧt ðə/ (t links to th)
"so engaging" → /soʊ ɪnˈɡeɪdʒɪŋ/ (o links to e)

speaker: Marcus
text: Yeah! She spoke fluently and confidently. Honestly, she was the most convincing speaker of the entire event.
ipa: jæ | ʃi spoʊk ˈfluəntli ənd ˈkɑnfɪdəntli | ˈɑnɪstli | ʃi wəz ðə moʊst kənˈvɪnsɪŋ ˈspiːkɚ əv ði ɪnˈtaɪɚ ɪˈvɛnt
stress: YEAH | SHE SPOKE FLUENTLY AND CONFIDENTLY | HONESTLY | SHE WAS THE MOST CONVINCING SPEAKER OF THE ENTIRE EVENT
linking:
"spoke fluently" → /spoʊk ˈfluəntli/ (k links to f)
"most convincing" → /moʊst kənˈvɪnsɪŋ/ (t links to c)

speaker: Nora
text: I’m a bit jealous now, haha. I should’ve gone. Was the venue nice?
ipa: aɪm ə bɪt ˈʤɛləs naʊ | hɑ hɑ | aɪ ʃʊdəv ɡɔn | wəz ðə ˈvɛnju naɪs
stress: I’M A BIT JEALOUS NOW | HAHA | I SHOULD’VE GONE | WAS THE VENUE NICE
linking:
"should’ve gone" → /ʃʊdəv ɡɔn/ (v links to g)
"venue nice" → /ˈvɛnju naɪs/ (u links to n)

speaker: Marcus
text: Totally. It was much better organized than the one we attended last year. Also, the food was surprisingly good.
ipa: ˈtoʊtəli | ɪt wəz mʌʧ ˈbɛtɚ ˈɔrɡəˌnaɪzd ðən ðə wʌn wi əˈtɛndɪd læst jɪr | ˈɔlsoʊ | ðə fud wəz sərˈpraɪzɪŋli ɡʊd
stress: TOTALLY | IT WAS MUCH BETTER ORGANIZED THAN THE ONE WE ATTENDED LAST YEAR | ALSO | THE FOOD WAS SURPRISINGLY GOOD
linking:
"better organized" → /ˈbɛtɚ ˈɔrɡəˌnaɪzd/ (r links to o)
"food was" → /fud wəz/ (d links to w)

speaker: Nora
text: Wait—better than last year’s? That’s hard to believe, considering last year we only had sandwiches.
ipa: weɪt | ˈbɛtɚ ðən læst jɪrz | ðæts hɑrd tu bɪˈliv | kənˈsɪdɚɪŋ læst jɪr wi ˈoʊnli hæd ˈsænwɪʧɪz
stress: WAIT | BETTER THAN LAST YEAR’S | THAT’S HARD TO BELIEVE | CONSIDERING LAST YEAR WE ONLY HAD SANDWICHES
linking:
"better than" → /ˈbɛtɚ ðən/ (r links to th)
"last year" → /læst jɪr/ (t links to y)

speaker: Marcus
text: Exactly! This time, they had actual meals and even a few vegan options. And the lines were shorter, too.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | ðɪs taɪm | ðeɪ hæd ˈækʧuəl milz ənd ˈivɪn ə fju ˈviɡən ˈɑpʃənz | ənd ðə laɪnz wɚ ˈʃɔrtɚ | tu
stress: EXACTLY | THIS TIME | THEY HAD ACTUAL MEALS AND EVEN A FEW VEGAN OPTIONS | AND THE LINES WERE SHORTER | TOO
linking:
"had actual" → /hæd ˈækʧuəl/ (d links to a)
"lines were" → /laɪnz wɚ/ (s links to w)

speaker: Nora
text: Nice! Did you do any networking?
ipa: naɪs | dɪd ju du ˈɛni ˈnɛtwɝkɪŋ
stress: NICE | DID YOU DO ANY NETWORKING
linking:
"did you" → /dɪd ju/ (d links to y)
"any networking" → /ˈɛni ˈnɛtwɝkɪŋ/ (y links to n)

speaker: Marcus
text: I did, but not as much as I should’ve. I was mostly focused on attending every talk I could.
ipa: aɪ dɪd | bət nɑt æz mʌʧ æz aɪ ˈʃʊdəv | aɪ wəz ˈmoʊstli ˈfoʊkəst ɑn əˈtɛndɪŋ ˈɛvri tɔk aɪ kʊd
stress: I DID | BUT NOT AS MUCH AS I SHOULD’VE | I WAS MOSTLY FOCUSED ON ATTENDING EVERY TALK I COULD
linking:
"not as" → /nɑt æz/ (t links into a)
"focused on" → /ˈfoʊkəst ɑn/ (t links into o)
"talk I" → /tɔk aɪ/ (k links to a)

speaker: Nora
text: You’re always more dedicated than the rest of us when it comes to learning. I would’ve probably wandered around and missed a few sessions.
ipa: jʊr ˈɔlweɪz mɔr ˈdɛdɪˌkeɪtɪd ðən ðə rɛst əv ʌs wɛn ɪt kʌmz tə ˈlɝnɪŋ | aɪ ˈwʊdəv ˈprɑbəbli ˈwɑndɚd əˈraʊnd ənd mɪst ə fju ˈsɛʃənz
stress: YOU’RE ALWAYS MORE DEDICATED THAN THE REST OF US WHEN IT COMES TO LEARNING | I WOULD’VE PROBABLY WANDERED AROUND AND MISSED A FEW SESSIONS
linking:
"rest of us" → /rɛst əv ʌs/ (t links to v)
"wandered around" → /ˈwɑndɚd əˈraʊnd/ (d links to a)
"missed a" → /mɪst ə/ (t links to a)

speaker: Marcus
text: Haha maybe, but you’re a lot better at talking to new people. I always feel a bit awkward.
ipa: hɑ hɑ ˈmeɪbi | bət jʊr ə lɑt ˈbɛtɚ ət ˈtɔkɪŋ tə nu ˈpipəl | aɪ ˈɔlweɪz fil ə bɪt ˈɔkwɚd
stress: HAHA MAYBE | BUT YOU’RE A LOT BETTER AT TALKING TO NEW PEOPLE | I ALWAYS FEEL A BIT AWKWARD
linking:
"you’re a" → /jʊr ə/ (r links to a)
"bit awkward" → /bɪt ˈɔkwɚd/ (t links to o)

speaker: Nora
text: We make a good team then — I’ll do the networking next time, and you can take notes.
ipa: wi meɪk ə ɡʊd tiːm ðɛn | aɪl du ðə ˈnɛtwɝkɪŋ nɛkst taɪm | ənd ju kən teɪk noʊts
stress: WE MAKE A GOOD TEAM THEN | I’LL DO THE NETWORKING NEXT TIME | AND YOU CAN TAKE NOTES
linking:
"networking next" → /ˈnɛtwɝkɪŋ nɛkst/ (g links to n)
"can take" → /kən teɪk/ (n links to t)

speaker: Marcus
text: Deal! Next time, we should both go. It’d be twice as productive.
ipa: diːl | nɛkst taɪm | wi ʃəd boʊθ ɡoʊ | ɪd bi twaɪs æz prəˈdʌktɪv
stress: DEAL | NEXT TIME | WE SHOULD BOTH GO | IT’D BE TWICE AS PRODUCTIVE
linking:
"should both" → /ʃəd boʊθ/ (d links to b)
"twice as" → /twaɪs æz/ (s links to a)
